title: World Seair Corp Seair
text:
The World Seair Corp Seair is an American <a href="ultralight%20trike">ultralight trike</a> <a href="flying%20boat">flying boat</a> that was designed and produced by <a href="World%20Seair%20Corporation">World Seair Corporation</a>. The aircraft was supplied as a completed, read-to-fly aircraft and introduced in July 1998.
A successor company, <a href="Seair%20Technologies">Seair Technologies</a> currently produces a similar concept, but different design aircraft, the <a href="Seair%20Technologies%20Seair%20Flying%20Boat">Seair Technologies Seair Flying Boat</a> that first flew circa 2002.
Design and development.
The Seair was designed as a US <a href="FAR%20103%20Ultralight%20Vehicles">FAR 103 Ultralight Vehicles</a> two-seat trainer. The aircraft has a standard empty weight of . It features a <a href="Flying%20wires">cable-braced</a> <a href="hang%20glider">hang glider</a>-style <a href="high-wing">high-wing</a>, weight-shift controls, a two-seats-in-<a href="tandem">tandem</a> open cockpit, inflatable boat hull and a single engine in <a href="pusher%20configuration">pusher configuration</a>.
The aircraft consists of a rigid-bottomed hull, with four independent air chambers, plus two inflatable outriggers. The trike wing is made from bolted-together <a href="aluminum">aluminum</a> tubing, with its single surface wing covered in <a href="Dacron">Dacron</a> sailcloth. The span wing is supported by a single tube-type <a href="kingpost">kingpost</a> and uses an "A" frame control bar. An optional water <a href="rudder">rudder</a> is controlled by foot pedals. An instrument panel is provided near the bow of the hull. The standard factory-supplied engine was the twin cylinder, <a href="two-stroke">two-stroke</a>, air-cooled <a href="Rotax%20503">Rotax 503</a> of , with the liquid-cooled <a href="Rotax%20582">Rotax 582</a> of optional.
The hull can be deflated and the wing folded for storage, ground transportation or stowage on a larger vessel. The aircraft can be assembled for flight in 20 minutes.
